item.title: Where is the world's busiest airport?
item.ExtractedText: October 2, 2013 -- Updated 1155 GMT (1955 HKT) CNN's Andrew Stevens looks at Hong Kong International's new midfield terminal and a potential third runway. October 4, 2013 -- Updated 1340 GMT (2140 HKT) How are ports adapting to cope with the new generation of giant cargo ships? Where is the world's busiest airport? September 27, 2013 -- Updated 1152 GMT (1952 HKT) London, Beijing or somewhere in the United States: Where is the world's busiest airport? Find out in our detailed infographic. London's new deep-water port September 26, 2013 -- Updated 1117 GMT (1917 HKT) The Gateway goes behind the scenes of 'London Gateway,' a new deep-water container port on the Thames estuary. Meet the midnight 'tunnel moles' September 20, 2013 -- Updated 1352 GMT (2152 HKT) It's approaching midnight, and a team of eager "tunnel moles" stands poised to carry out maintenance on the world's longest undersea structure. September 13, 2013 -- Updated 0927 GMT (1727 HKT) Urban gondolas are offering cheap and effective methods of mass-transportation in some of South America's biggest cities. World's longest undersea tunnel September 11, 2013 -- Updated 1709 GMT (0109 HKT) Atika Shubert explores the flow of goods and people through the Channel Tunnel, connecting UK and continental Europe. Sailing world's busiest shipping lane September 5, 2013 -- Updated 1135 GMT (1935 HKT) How do you squeeze 500 ships through a straight of water just 21 miles wide in a single day? Find out as The Gateway visits the English Channel. Linking Europe and Asia by rail June 27, 2013 -- Updated 0923 GMT (1723 HKT) The Silk Road was once a series of dusty trails forged by traders traveling between Asia and Europe. Today it takes the form of a bustling railway. Introducing the world's biggest ship June 26, 2013 -- Updated 1249 GMT (2049 HKT) An all new class of container ship, the Triple E is a quarter-of-a-mile long and built from enough steel to construct 8 Eiffel Towers. 8 spectacular infrastructure projects June 18, 2013 -- Updated 1136 GMT (1936 HKT) Take a peek at some of the most exciting travel infrastructure projects currently in the works around the world. Goodbye to Kai Tak airport June 14, 2013 -- Updated 1057 GMT (1857 HKT) Sitting partly in the city and partly at sea, Hong Kong's Kai Tak International was one of the world's most exciting (and terrifying) airports to fly into. Could drones be future highways? May 31, 2013 -- Updated 1734 GMT (0134 HKT) Two ambitious tech start-ups are aiming to create a network of automated drones that will help connect rural and under-developed areas.
